sections.name: intro_1_ambient_establish
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 25 (LOW 0.0–0.4) fits an intro where the goal is space and anticipation rather than impact; a gentle sweep supports early musical elements (likely light percussion/pads) without demanding attention. Layering Decision: Single template is chosen because low energy sections should default to open/simple and avoid layering overkill ("Less is Often More" + SINGLE template when energy < 0.5). Template Compatibility: N/A (single template) — the point here is clarity and calm. Channel Choices: Shutter=open to match energy <0.5 and preserve strobe budget for later peaks; Color=blue to set a cool, spacious mood and establish palette continuity; Gobo=open to keep a clean readable look and because this is foundational atmosphere (default open gobo 50–60%). Flow: Starts at SOFT_HOME and gently moves toward FORWARD, giving a smooth on-ramp for the next medium-energy verse without a pose jump; keeping the same cool color also avoids early visual churn. Confidence: 5/5 — clean low-energy choice, fully aligned with restraint budgets and sets up the song’s visual language.

sections.name: verse_1_groove_support
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 55 (MEDIUM 0.5–0.7) suits a verse groove where rhythmic definition increases but vocals still need support rather than spectacle. Layering Decision: Two templates are used because medium energy can benefit from a main movement + accent layer, and this section is long enough to justify added texture without escalating to peak intensity (2-template layering rule for 0.5–0.8). Template Compatibility: Complementary by movement type + plane separation: verse_sweep_pulse provides smooth positional sweep (tilt/overall sweep feel) while ping_pong_chase is dimmer-only motion on static positions; this is "static hold + dynamic movement" and avoids competing large sweeps. Channel Choices: Shutter=pulse (not strobe) because energy is moderate and we want beat reinforcement without spending strobe budget early (pulse budget 10–20% overall); Color stays blue for continuity across multiple sections (color restraint: hold 2–4 sections); Gobo=open to keep readability since we already added a second template layer. Flow: Continues from the intro’s gentle sweep into a more defined verse pulse; end pose moves toward AUDIENCE_CENTER to set up a transition/build that can tighten focus. Confidence: 4/5 — strong groove layering with good restraint; minor compromise is that pulse shutter adds intensity, but it remains within medium-energy rules and preserves strobes for later.

sections.name: transition_1_palette_cleanse
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 45 sits at the low-medium boundary, ideal for a section boundary where musical phrasing likely shifts (end of verse into a new idea) without needing peak intensity. Layering Decision: Single template because transitions benefit from clean pose changes and clarity (SINGLE template during transitions rule). Template Compatibility: N/A — the transition template already includes fade-through-black repositioning, which should not be visually competed against. Channel Choices: Shutter=open to keep the transition elegant and avoid strobe/pulse fatigue; Color=white marks a major structural boundary (allowed color change at major transitions) and provides a neutral "palette cleanse"; Gobo=open because the transition’s purpose is clarity and repositioning in darkness. Flow: This intentionally breaks the prior groove, resetting to SOFT_HOME so the next build can re-enter with controlled tension; the white color also sets up a more dramatic warm/cool choice later. Confidence: 5/5 — textbook use of a smooth transition with restrained channels and a justified major color shift.

sections.name: build_1_tension_ramp
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 70 is upper-medium, consistent with a pre-drop build where percussion density and harmonic tension rise. Layering Decision: Two templates because builds often benefit from a foundational motion plus a tension micro-layer to ramp energy without spending strobe budget too early (2-template layering for 0.5–0.8 and build sections). Template Compatibility: Complementary via scale contrast + movement type: tension_mirror_build provides larger accelerating pendulum/sweep arcs, while locked_with_tremble adds high-frequency micro-motion while staying position-locked; this is "large sweeping + small detail" and avoids two big sweeps fighting. Channel Choices: Shutter=pulse (not strobe) because we’re building energy but saving strobe for the actual drop/chorus peaks (shutter rules + strobe restraint); Color stays white to maintain the build’s “tension/neutral” feel and avoid too many color scenes; Gobo=clouds is added because movement is not at maximum speed and the build benefits from atmosphere/texture (gobo allowed when movement is slower/moderate). This also keeps gobo usage limited (we’ll keep gobos off for many other sections). Flow: Comes out of the smooth transition already in white and intensifies motion/tension without a jarring pose jump; ends centered to set up a focused impact template next. Confidence: 4/5 — strong complementary layering; the only caution is adding a gobo during a build, but it’s a moderate-density breakup (clouds) and movement isn’t “fast+complex gobo,” so compatibility is maintained.

sections.name: drop_hit_1_signature_impact
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 90 (HIGH 0.8–1.0) indicates a true drop/impact moment where the music likely has a strong downbeat transient and sustained high-energy groove. Layering Decision: Single template because this is a signature moment where the template IS the moment; also avoids compounding intensity (single powerful template rule for signature hits). Template Compatibility: N/A — explosive_drop_strobe already contains a hit phase and sustain phase; adding more would risk sensory overload. Channel Choices: Shutter=strobe_medium to honor the drop intensity while managing fatigue (strobe only at peaks; medium rather than fast to reduce overload). Strobe budget check: this section is 8 bars; cumulative strobe so far becomes 8/164 = 4.9%, well under 30%. Color changes to red to mark the major transition into the first peak (allowed at major transition; warm color increases perceived intensity). Gobo=open because the movement is intense and strobing is already complex—per integration rule, keep other channels simple when one is intense (avoid fast movement + complex gobo). Flow: The build ended centered and tense; this snaps into a focused explosive look, then ends FORWARD to open the stage for a longer chorus sustain pattern next. Confidence: 5/5 — perfect peak deployment: strobe reserved for a true high-energy moment, warm color shift signals the drop, and gobo restraint prevents overload.

sections.name: chorus_1_sustain_motion
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 85 is still high, but more “sustain” than “initial hit,” fitting a chorus where the groove continues and needs hypnotic movement rather than constant impact-only accents. Layering Decision: Two templates because high-energy chorus sections benefit from main movement + accent, and we can create spatial dialogue/texture without resorting to triple-layer complexity (2-template layering for 0.5–0.8+; allowed here because it’s chorus sustain, not a single drop hit). Template Compatibility: Complementary by rhythm offset + movement type: energetic_fan_pulse provides continuous circular/pulsing motion, while sequential_tilt_drop adds occasional left-to-right cascading vertical hits that read as fills on top of the main bed. This is “continuous + punctuated sequential,” avoiding redundancy. Channel Choices: Shutter=open (not strobe) to prevent strobe fatigue after the drop and to keep the chorus readable despite layered movement (rule: avoid strobe→strobe transitions; also keep ONE intense element at a time). Color remains red to hold the same scene across multiple peak sections (color restraint: don’t change every section). Gobo=open because movement is energetic; adding dense gobos would overload. Flow: Smoothly continues from the drop’s red palette but relaxes shutter intensity from strobe to open, giving the audience’s eyes a break while keeping motion energy high; ends centered to set up a potential breakdown/glitch contrast. Confidence: 4/5 — strong restraint choice (open shutter) immediately after a strobe hit; minor compromise is that energy is high yet shutter is open, but this is intentional per strobe budget/fatigue rules.

sections.name: breakdown_1_glitch_contrast
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 75 is medium-high, appropriate for a breakdown that may reduce melodic density but increases rhythmic/texture interest (glitch/stutter feel). Layering Decision: Two templates because this is a contrast section where complexity can come from texture rather than sheer brightness; layering adds richness without needing strobe. Template Compatibility: Complementary via rhythm offset and movement type: digital_glitch is rapid irregular snap/stutter, while random_bounce is more organic physics-like motion; the contrast between “digital” and “organic” prevents redundancy and creates a layered texture that doesn’t compete in identical timing. Channel Choices: Shutter=pulse to give rhythmic definition without escalating to strobe (energy 0.5–0.7 rule; at 75 it’s slightly above, but within ±0.3 tolerance reasoning: we’re deliberately keeping shutter moderate to preserve strobe budget for the next peak). Color changes to purple to mark a major structural contrast (chorus → breakdown), and to shift mood cooler/edgier without introducing a totally new rainbow scene. Gobo=dots to add a “digital pixel” texture, but we keep shutter at pulse (not strobe) so we don’t stack too many intense elements; dots density is moderate-high but acceptable because the movement is not a sustained fast sweep—it's snap-based where the texture reads. Flow: This deliberately pivots away from the red chorus into a cooler breakdown scene; ending at SOFT_HOME prepares a clean re-build. Confidence: 3/5 — the concept is strong, but it’s a busier visual section (snap texture + gobo). I mitigated by using pulse instead of strobe and by making this the main “textural” gobo moment to stay within gobo budget.

sections.name: build_2_crescendo_to_final_peak
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 80 indicates a strong build where the music likely reintroduces drive and anticipates a bigger final chorus/climax. Layering Decision: Two templates because this is a long ramp; a reveal/formation layer helps the build feel like it is “assembling” toward the peak (layering for builds). Template Compatibility: Complementary by scale contrast + plane separation: crescendo_sweep_build provides broad sweep acceleration, while chase_from_point is a sequential activation/reveal that reads as structural staging rather than another competing sweep. This is “large sweep + formation reveal,” not “fast+fast.” Channel Choices: Shutter=open (not strobe) despite high build energy to preserve strobe budget for the final peak and to avoid strobe fatigue (strobe reserved for peaks >0.7, but not mandatory; restraint principle). Color stays purple to maintain continuity from breakdown through the build (color restraint: hold 2–4 sections). Gobo=open to reduce visual load because we already used dots in the prior section; also avoids complex gobo with accelerating movement. Flow: Starts from SOFT_HOME (end of breakdown) and progressively tightens to AUDIENCE_CENTER, making the next drop/chorus impact feel earned; keeping purple maintains a coherent “act 2” palette. Confidence: 4/5 — strong build logic and good budget management; slight compromise is using open shutter at energy 80, but it’s justified as a strategic hold-back for the final strobe peak.

sections.name: chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 95 is the climactic peak tier (HIGH 0.8–1.0), appropriate for the biggest chorus where the song’s maximal density and excitement likely occur. Layering Decision: Single template because this is one of the 1–2 climactic moments where a dedicated peak template should dominate; adding layers risks chaos and reduces readability (single powerful template for signature moments + avoid fast+fast). Template Compatibility: N/A — chorus_circle_strobe already provides sustained hypnotic motion plus strobe. Channel Choices: Shutter=strobe_fast to clearly differentiate this as the biggest peak, while still respecting the strobe budget. Strobe budget check: strobe sections are bars 57–64 (8 bars) + 113–128 (16 bars) = 24 bars strobing; 24/164 = 14.6%, under 30%. Color changes back to red to signal “return to peak” and to complete a simple 3-scene palette (blue intro/verse, white transition/build, red peaks, purple breakdown/build). This is a major transition, so color change is justified and still within ≤5 total changes. Gobo=open to avoid stacking dense texture on top of fast circular motion + fast strobe (integration rule: keep ONE intense, others simple). Flow: The prior build held back on strobe; this release into fast strobe feels earned and maximally impactful. Ending FORWARD opens the look to decrescendo/outro without a hard stop. Confidence: 5/5 — strong climax execution with clean integration and healthy strobe budget remaining.

sections.name: outro_release_and_resolve
sections.reasoning: Energy Match: Energy 35 returns to LOW-MED territory, consistent with an outro where musical elements thin out and the goal is resolution rather than drive. Layering Decision: Two templates are used (rather than single) because the outro is long (36 bars) and benefits from slow evolving depth without increasing intensity; this is a controlled, complementary ambient layering rather than “more energy.” Template Compatibility: Complementary via movement type + scale contrast: pendulum provides gentle organic sway with offsets, while converge_diverge provides slow breathing expansion/contraction; both are slow (not fast+fast) and operate with different motion character (sway vs iris-like expansion), creating texture without competition. Channel Choices: Shutter=open to match energy <0.5 and to give full relief after the peak strobing (avoid strobe fatigue). Color returns to blue to “cool down” emotionally and mirror the intro, creating narrative symmetry; this is a major transition (peak → outro) and remains within the ≤5 color change limit. Gobo=open to keep the outro clean and readable and to keep total gobo usage under 50% of bars. Flow: Smoothly decrescendos from the peak by removing strobe and slowing motion; pose eases back to SOFT_HOME for a final rest state. Confidence: 5/5 — strong release strategy with complementary slow layers and excellent restraint after the climax.

plan.overall_strategy: Overall Strategy: Build a clear 4-scene color narrative with restraint: BLUE (intro/verse calm), WHITE (transition + tension build), RED (drop/chorus peaks), PURPLE (breakdown + rebuild), then back to BLUE for resolution. Movement hierarchy follows the design philosophy: low-energy sections use single ambient templates; medium sections use 2-layer complementary combinations where one layer is structural (sweep/pose) and the other is rhythmic (dimmer chase/pulse) to avoid redundancy. Peak moments are intentionally isolated as single-template signatures with strobe reserved for only the true drops/chorus climax, keeping total strobe well under the 30% fatigue threshold. Gobos are treated as rare texture accents (clouds in build, dots in breakdown) and otherwise kept open to preserve beam readability, especially during fast/high-energy movement. Transitions prioritize clean pose changes (fade-through-black) and avoid abrupt vertical jumps by ending sections in poses that naturally set up the next (SOFT_HOME ↔ FORWARD ↔ AUDIENCE_CENTER).

sections.name: intro_1_ambient_establish__gentle_sweep_breathe_ALL
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Single low-energy ambient look, so ALL fixtures run one template for calm clarity (no layering). Intensity: Plan energy 25 maps to SMOOTH. Layer priority: Only layer, so 0. Timing: Bars 1–16 match plan exactly with no gaps/overlaps.

sections.name: verse_1_groove_support__verse_sweep_pulse_LEFT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Two-template medium section uses disjoint LEFT+RIGHT; LEFT carries the structural sweep bed. Intensity: Plan energy 55 maps to DRAMATIC. Layer priority: Structural sweep is main (0), chase becomes accent (1). Timing: Bars 17–32 match plan exactly.

sections.name: verse_1_groove_support__ping_pong_chase_RIGHT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: RIGHT is disjoint from LEFT, enabling concurrent accent without fixture conflicts; ping-pong reads as rhythmic counterpoint. Intensity: Energy 55 → DRAMATIC. Layer priority: Accent layer sits above the sweep bed (1). Timing: Bars 17–32 match plan exactly.

sections.name: transition_1_palette_cleanse__smooth_fade_transition_ALL
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Transition is intentionally single-template for clean fade-through-black repositioning, so ALL only. Intensity: Energy 45 is treated as low-medium boundary but maps to SMOOTH per the plan’s transition intent (keeps it elegant). Layer priority: Single layer (0). Timing: Bars 33–40 match plan exactly.

sections.name: build_1_tension_ramp__tension_mirror_build_LEFT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Two-template build uses disjoint LEFT+RIGHT; LEFT runs the large-scale accelerating mirror/sweep as the structural foundation. Intensity: Energy 70 maps to DRAMATIC. Layer priority: Large build motion is main (0), micro-tremble is accent (1). Timing: Bars 41–56 match plan exactly.

sections.name: build_1_tension_ramp__locked_with_tremble_RIGHT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: RIGHT is disjoint from LEFT, allowing the locked micro-motion to add tension detail without conflicting with the main sweep. Intensity: Energy 70 → DRAMATIC. Layer priority: Micro-detail sits above the structural build (1). Timing: Bars 41–56 match plan exactly.

sections.name: drop_hit_1_signature_impact__explosive_drop_strobe_ALL
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Signature drop is a single-template moment, so ALL for unified impact and no competing layers. Intensity: Energy 90 maps to INTENSE. Layer priority: Single layer (0). Timing: Bars 57–64 match plan exactly.

sections.name: chorus_1_sustain_motion__energetic_fan_pulse_LEFT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Two-template high-energy sustain uses disjoint LEFT+RIGHT; LEFT carries the continuous fan/pulse bed for readability. Intensity: Energy 85 maps to INTENSE. Layer priority: Continuous bed is main (0), sequential tilt drops become accents (1). Timing: Bars 65–80 match plan exactly.

sections.name: chorus_1_sustain_motion__sequential_tilt_drop_RIGHT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: RIGHT is disjoint from LEFT so the sequential vertical hits read as spatial fills without conflicts. Intensity: Energy 85 → INTENSE. Layer priority: Punctuated cascade is an accent above the continuous bed (1). Timing: Bars 65–80 match plan exactly.

sections.name: breakdown_1_glitch_contrast__digital_glitch_ODD
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Two-template texture section uses disjoint ODD+EVEN to emphasize alternating glitch/organic contrast across the rig with no overlap. Intensity: Energy 75 maps to INTENSE per required mapping. Layer priority: Digital glitch is the defining texture, so it is main (0); bounce is supporting motion (1). Timing: Bars 81–96 match plan exactly.

sections.name: breakdown_1_glitch_contrast__random_bounce_EVEN
sections.reasoning: Targeting: EVEN is disjoint from ODD, enabling concurrent organic bounce without fixture conflicts and reinforcing the breakdown’s contrast. Intensity: Energy 75 → INTENSE (per mapping). Layer priority: Bounce is secondary texture under the glitch identity (1). Timing: Bars 81–96 match plan exactly.

sections.name: build_2_crescendo_to_final_peak__crescendo_sweep_build_LEFT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Two-template build uses disjoint LEFT+RIGHT; LEFT runs the broad accelerating sweep as the main ramp. Intensity: Energy 80 maps to INTENSE. Layer priority: Broad sweep is structural main (0); chase-from-point is the formation/reveal accent (1). Timing: Bars 97–112 match plan exactly.

sections.name: build_2_crescendo_to_final_peak__chase_from_point_RIGHT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: RIGHT is disjoint from LEFT, so the sequential reveal can play against the sweep without conflicts and reads as staging toward the peak. Intensity: Energy 80 → INTENSE. Layer priority: Reveal/chase is an accent layer (1). Timing: Bars 97–112 match plan exactly.

sections.name: chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment__chorus_circle_strobe_ALL
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Climactic peak is intentionally single-template, so ALL fixtures unify into the signature circle+strobe look (no layering). Intensity: Energy 95 maps to INTENSE. Layer priority: Single layer (0). Timing: Bars 113–128 match plan exactly.

sections.name: outro_release_and_resolve__pendulum_LEFT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: Two-template long outro uses disjoint LEFT+RIGHT to add slow evolving depth without raising intensity; LEFT carries the gentle sway as the main ambient motion. Intensity: Energy 35 maps to SMOOTH. Layer priority: Pendulum sway is the primary motion bed (0); converge/diverge is the breathing accent (1). Timing: Bars 129–164 match plan exactly.

sections.name: outro_release_and_resolve__converge_diverge_RIGHT
sections.reasoning: Targeting: RIGHT is disjoint from LEFT, allowing the slow expansion/contraction to complement the sway without conflicts and create a gentle stereo field. Intensity: Energy 35 → SMOOTH. Layer priority: Breathing motion is secondary to the sway bed (1). Timing: Bars 129–164 match plan exactly.

implementation.overall_strategy: Overall Strategy: Build a clear 4-scene color narrative with restraint: BLUE (intro/verse calm), WHITE (transition + tension build), RED (drop/chorus peaks), PURPLE (breakdown + rebuild), then back to BLUE for resolution. Movement hierarchy follows the design philosophy: low-energy sections use single ambient templates; medium sections use 2-layer complementary combinations where one layer is structural (sweep/pose) and the other is rhythmic (dimmer chase/pulse) to avoid redundancy. Peak moments are intentionally isolated as single-template signatures with strobe reserved for only the true drops/chorus climax, keeping total strobe well under the 30% fatigue threshold. Gobos are treated as rare texture accents (clouds in build, dots in breakdown) and otherwise kept open to preserve beam readability, especially during fast/high-energy movement. Transitions prioritize clean pose changes (fade-through-black) and avoid abrupt vertical jumps by ending sections in poses that naturally set up the next (SOFT_HOME ↔ FORWARD ↔ AUDIENCE_CENTER).
implementation.implementation_approach: Implemented each plan section as bar-aligned blocks matching the plan exactly. Single-template sections target ALL fixtures with layer_priority 0 for maximum clarity (intro, transition, drop hit, final peak). Two-template sections use only disjoint target pairs to avoid conflicts: LEFT+RIGHT for spatial dialogue where a main bed plus accent reads clearly, and ODD+EVEN for alternating/texture sections to enhance rhythmic separation. Intensity is mapped strictly from plan energy to SMOOTH/DRAMATIC/INTENSE. Base poses follow the plan’s flow goals (SOFT_HOME → FORWARD → AUDIENCE_CENTER) to minimize pose jumps at transitions; priority 0 is always the structural/main layer, priority 1 the rhythmic/texture accent.

evaluation.story_overview: The sequence opens in a cool, spacious BLUE with a single ambient sweep to establish mood, then splits into LEFT/RIGHT conversational movement through the verse to build spatial interest. Tension builds through two mirror/locked layers into isolated strobe signature hits for the drops, a gritty digital breakdown that contrasts motion language, and a final release that returns to calm BLUE resolution.

category_scores.reasoning: All plan section boundaries are bar-aligned and implementation metadata states beat_aligned and bar_aligned. Every planned section (e.g., 'intro_1_ambient_establish' bars 1-16, 'verse_1_groove_support' bars 17-32, 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' bars 57-64) begins on downbeats and matches the intended musical phrases, with no off-beat starts.
strengths: Sections start on downbeats and adhere to bar boundaries (implementation: bar_aligned).
'intro_1_ambient_establish' (bars 1-16) and 'verse_1_groove_support' (bars 17-32) respect phrase lengths for establishing and answering.
weaknesses: No explicit sub-bar micro-timing (±50ms) verification beyond metadata; assume bar alignment implies tight sync but micro-adjustments could further tighten hits for percussion accents.

category_scores.reasoning: Energy progression is coherent: low-energy intro (25) → medium verse (55) → tension builds (70-80) → high-energy drops/chorus (90-95) → restrained outro (35). Templates chosen generally match the stated energies. Minor mismatch: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (energy=75) uses two aggressive templates (digital_glitch, random_bounce) which can read slightly higher than the stated intent.
strengths: 'intro_1_ambient_establish' uses a low-energy ambient template (gentle_sweep_breathe) consistent with energy=25.
'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' (bars 57-64) and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' (bars 113-128) reserve high-intensity templates as expected for peaks.
weaknesses: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) pairing digital_glitch + random_bounce may push perceived energy above the stated 75, reducing contrast with the following build.
'build_1_tension_ramp' (bars 41-56) uses locked_with_tremble which can compete with the mirror build if not dialed to lower amplitude.

category_scores.reasoning: Good template variety overall and layering reaches plan target (60% of sections layered). Several layered sections use complementary Left/Right roles (e.g., verse, build_1, chorus_1). However, one layered pairing risks redundancy/chaos: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' stacks two motion-heavy templates (digital_glitch + random_bounce).
strengths: Wide range of templates across the plan (no single template >40% of time).
Layering occurs in 6 of 10 plan sections (60%) which meets the 40-60% target: verse_1, build_1, chorus_1, breakdown_1, build_2, outro_release.
weaknesses: 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) layers two fast/dynamic templates (digital_glitch + random_bounce) — overlapping movement types risk visual clutter.
'build_1_tension_ramp' (tension_mirror_build + locked_with_tremble) could become two competing structural layers if tremble amplitude isn't constrained.

category_scores.reasoning: Full song coverage with no temporal gaps or overlaps that create fixture conflicts. Overlapping sections correctly use disjoint fixture groups (LEFT+RIGHT, ODD+EVEN). No instance of ALL overlapping with another group.
strengths: No target conflicts detected: LEFT+RIGHT overlaps (e.g., bars 17-32, 41-56, 65-80, 97-112, 129-164) are valid disjoint pairs.
ODD+EVEN overlap for 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) is valid and avoids conflicts.
weaknesses: Implementation uses 'ALL' for transitions/drops (e.g., 'transition_1_palette_cleanse' bars 33-40, 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' bars 57-64, 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' bars 113-128) — this is safe here but leaves no room for simultaneous secondary layers during those bars; if a future designer attempts to layer, it will create conflicts.

category_scores.reasoning: Strobe usage is conservative and reserved for true peaks. Strobe appears only in 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' (bars 57-64) and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' (bars 113-128) -> 24 strobe bars out of 164 total bars = 14.63% strobe usage, well under the 30% fatigue threshold.
strengths: Strobe limited to major impact moments: 'drop_hit_1_signature_impact' and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment'.
Most of the song uses open shutter or pulse for builds and verses, preserving strobe impact.
weaknesses: No specific mention of pulse vs open on medium-energy sections (e.g., 'verse_1_groove_support') — ensure pulses are subtle to avoid creeping strobe-like fatigue.

category_scores.reasoning: Plan defines a coherent 4-scene palette (BLUE, WHITE, RED, PURPLE → BACK TO BLUE) and holds colors across logical transitions. Unique color scenes = 4, within the 3-5 recommended range, and color changes mark major transitions (intro→build→drop→breakdown→resolution).
strengths: Four clear color scenes (BLUE, WHITE, RED, PURPLE) with narrative mapping to energy levels.
Color changes occur at major transitions: e.g., switch to WHITE for tension ('build_1' bars 41-56), RED for drop/chorus ('drop_hit_1' and 'chorus_1').
weaknesses: Implementation doesn't explicitly list colors per implementation section — ensure color holds across adjacent sections (e.g., maintain WHITE through transition_1_palette_cleanse into build_1 to preserve narrative).

category_scores.reasoning: Gobos are used sparingly as planned. Plan applies textures in build and breakdown (clouds in builds, dots in breakdown) and keeps gobo open otherwise. Estimated gobo usage in plan: build_1 (bars 41-56), breakdown_1 (81-96), build_2 (97-112) → 3/10 sections with gobos = 30% gobo usage; open gobo ~70%. This is slightly above the 50-60% open target but still conservative and preserves beam readability during fast movement.
strengths: 'build_1' and 'build_2' (bars 41-56 and 97-112) reserved for cloud-like gobo texture — appropriate for tension.
'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) uses dot/breakup for atmosphere contrast, creating memorable texture moments.
weaknesses: Open gobo is at ~70% (7/10 sections) rather than the ideal 50-60%; result is safe but slightly over-conservative and misses opportunities to texture additional mid-energy moments.
Potential mismatch: complex gobos applied on builds with non-trivial movement (e.g., 'crescendo_sweep_build') risk visual overload unless gobo scale is adjusted.

category_scores.reasoning: Layering depth is strong (6/10 sections layered = 60%), and targeting uses a healthy variety of semantic groups (ALL, LEFT, RIGHT, ODD, EVEN). Channels are coordinated with LEFT/RIGHT dialogues in verse/chorus and ODD/EVEN for breakdown, demonstrating spatial thinking and temporal layering without flattening to ALL.
strengths: Layering present in key moments: verse_1, build_1, chorus_1, breakdown_1, build_2, outro_release (6/10 = 60%).
Good use of semantic target groups: LEFT/RIGHT for dialogue; ODD/EVEN for textural breakdowns.
weaknesses: A few layered pairings (notably 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast') risk being two competing rhythmic layers—consider making one layer structural or tonal to improve depth.
Implementation uses ALL for signature hits which reduces potential for additional layered accents during those same bars.

evaluation.summary:
Overall the plan and implementation demonstrate a mature, restrained design philosophy: bar-aligned sections, a clear 4-color narrative (BLUE → WHITE → RED → PURPLE → BLUE), and intentional strobe and gobo usage reserved for climactic moments ('drop_hit_1_signature_impact' bars 57-64 and 'chorus_2_peak_strobe_moment' bars 113-128). Layering is deliberately used in 6/10 sections (60%) with LEFT/RIGHT and ODD/EVEN targeting avoiding any fixture conflicts; timing coverage is complete and implementation is beat-aligned.

Primary areas to tighten are micro-level layering compatibility and texture assignment. Specifically, 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96) layers two aggressive motion templates (digital_glitch + random_bounce) that can compete visually; consider converting one layer to a subtle texture or slower rhythmic pulse. Also verify gobo scale on fast sweep builds so patterns read cleanly (see 'crescendo_sweep_build' bars 97-112). Overall, this is a high-quality plan and implementation that passes the 70 threshold comfortably.
actionable_feedback: Breakdown layering fix: For 'breakdown_1_glitch_contrast' (bars 81-96), change one layer to a slower texture or tonal layer — e.g., replace random_bounce with a muted 'low_pulse_dimmer' or 'soft_spot_hold' to create contrast with digital_glitch.

Tremble restraint in build_1: In 'build_1_tension_ramp' (bars 41-56) lower locked_with_tremble amplitude or change it to 'locked_subtle_tremble' so tension_mirror_build remains the dominant structural element.

Gobo usage tuning: Move one gobo texture from build_2 ('crescendo_sweep_build' bars 97-112) to a later sub-section or reduce gobo scale when paired with fast sweeps. If gobo must be present on sweep, use large-scale breakup or very soft edge gobos to maintain beam legibility.

Color hold guidance: Ensure 'transition_1_palette_cleanse' (bars 33-40) remains in WHITE and flows into 'build_1' WHITE to avoid an unnecessary color flicker; reserve RED for 'drop_hit_1' and 'chorus_1' to keep the RED scene impactful.

ALL usage strategy: Consider changing one of the ALL signature bars to LEFT+RIGHT with a synchronized quick ALL flash at the downbeat to allow layered accents directly before/after the main ALL hit. For example, make 'drop_hit_1' use a 1-bar ALL impact at the downbeat and surrounding 1–2 bars use LEFT/RIGHT accents so secondary layers can sit adjacent without conflict.

Micro-timing: Though implementation is bar_aligned, audition ±1-2 sub-beat offsets for percussion-heavy hits (e.g., the initial hit of 'drop_hit_1') to tighten perceived synchronization with percussive transients.

shutter_issues: No major issues; ensure medium-energy pulses (verse) remain subtle and not strobe-like.
color_issues: Ensure transition_1_palette_cleanse holds WHITE into build_1 to avoid distracting micro-changes.
gobo_issues: Gobos on fast sweeps (e.g., 'crescendo_sweep_build') must be large-scale or low-contrast to avoid busy visual noise.
visual_impact_issues: Breakdown layering and gobo scale could be tuned to increase clarity of peak moments.
